text: Does it exist a Julia library that enables better printing of types in stacktraces? When the programs gets big the type information is so nested that it's almost impossible to read. Would be super practical with a printing setting that only displayed the upper most types, where you could show the sub properties if needed

elements.text: Does it exist a Julia library that enables better printing of types in stacktraces? When the programs gets big the type information is so nested that it's almost impossible to read. Would be super practical with a printing setting that only displayed the upper most types, where you could show the sub properties if needed

text:
Not exactly what you want but:
<https://github.com/jkrumbiegel/ClearStacktrace.jl>
which is included in julia-1.6 (beta1, released yesterday)

elements.text: Not exactly what you want but:
which is included in julia-1.6 (beta1, released yesterday)

text:
Also julia 1.6 makes things that have aliases, like `Vector{Any}` display as the alias, (not `Array{Any,1}` )
Which has a big effect on things like `StridedArray`
